name: pytest_testing_framework
description: Python testing with pytest for automated test suites

args: def test_addition(): assert 1 + 1 == 2; print('Test: addition passed'); def test_multiplication(): assert 2 * 3 == 6; print('Test: multiplication passed'); test_addition(); test_multiplication(); print('All tests executed')

expected_output.example:
Test: addition passed
Test: multiplication passed
All tests executed

Pytest-style tests

args: import pytest; @pytest.fixture; def sample_data(): return [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; def test_with_fixture(): data = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; assert len(data) == 5; assert sum(data) == 15; print('Fixture test passed'); test_with_fixture()

expected_output.example:
Fixture test passed

Fixtures provide test data

args: import pytest; @pytest.mark.parametrize('input,expected', [(1, 2), (2, 3), (3, 4)]); def test_increment(input, expected): result = input + 1; assert result == expected; print(f'Test: {input} + 1 = {expected} passed'); [test_increment(1, 2), test_increment(2, 3), test_increment(3, 4)]; print('Parametrized tests complete')

expected_output.example:
Test: 1 + 1 = 2 passed
Test: 2 + 1 = 3 passed
Test: 3 + 1 = 4 passed
Parametrized tests complete

Data-driven testing
